Hardware Engineer Job at Moniepoint




        
    

        
        Moniepoint Incorporated is a global business payments and banking platform and recently became QED Investors’ first investment in Africa. We are the partner of choice for over 600,000 businesses of all sizes, powering the dreams of SMBs and providing them with equal access to the tools they need to grow and scale.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hardware Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Key Responsibilities
Design and Development:
     

            
    




	Design and develop PCBs using tools like Proteus/Eagle.
	Collaborate with team members to ensure the integrity and efficiency of hardware designs.
	Support rapid prototyping initiatives.
	Design diagnostic tools for quick defect detection


Debugging and Troubleshooting:


	Utilize oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and other debugging tools to diagnose and rectify hardware issues.
	Collaborate with the lead engineer and team members to resolve complex hardware challenges.


Documentation:


	Maintain detailed documentation for all hardware designs, changes, and iterations.
	Assist in the creation of user manuals and technical guides.


Collaboration:


	Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineering and product management, to ensure smooth integration and meet product objectives.
	Attend team meetings and provide updates on project progress and challenges.
	Provide continuous training for field repair engineers.


Requirements


	Minimum of B.Sc./HND
	3-5 years of experience in a related role.
	Experience with the Agency banking business would be an added advantage.
	Good computer skills. Must have knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
	Good Relationship skills and emotional intelligence skills
	Must be self-driven and be able to take initiative
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work with limited supervision.
	Proficient in Englis.


What we can offer you


	Culture -We put our people first and prioritize the well-being of every team member. We’ve built a company where all opinions carry weight and where all voices are heard. We value and respect each other and always look out for one another. Above all, we are human.
	Learning - We have a learning and development-focused environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing, training, and regular internal technical talks.
	Compensation - You’ll receive an attractive salary, pension, health insurance, annual bonus, plus other benefits.

Executive Assistant Job at ACE Real Estates Development Limited




        
    

        
        ACE Real Estates Development Limited is a real estate company located in Lekki Phase 1, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Acting as the point of contact between the CEO and employees, clients or other external partners
	Aiding the CEO in the development, coordination, and implementation of strategic plans for the company.
	Attending and contributing to meetings on behalf of the CEO, reporting back and following up if required.
	Ensuring proper and timely follow-up on reports from units and departments.
	Researching for, and preparation of speeches and presentations in a variety of formats to support the activities of the CEO.
	Maintaining effective and comprehensive electronic & paper filing systems to ensure efficient flow of correspondence and documentation.
	Making local/international travel arrangements on behalf of the CEO.
	Provide technical assistance to the CEO for the execution of the Roadmap and Operating Plan for the generation of revenue
	Managing the CEO’s calendars, setting up meetings and making appointments
	Organizing and preparing for meetings, including gathering documents and attending to the logistics of meetings
	Making travel and accommodation arrangements, when needed
	Taking minutes during meetings
	Maintaining comprehensive and accurate records for the CEO
	Reviewing, prioritizing and responding to emails
	Keep all documents given to you or that you are a glimpse of confidential.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@acerealestates.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Executive",
  "description": "ACE Real Estates Development Limited is a real estate company located in Lekki Phase 1, Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Executive
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
Sales Target Achievement:


	Develop and implement effective sales strategies to meet or exceed sales targets and objectives.
	Leadership:
	Cordinate sales department to meet company&#39;s sales target.


Prospecting and Lead Generation:


	Qualify leads and convert them into potential customers.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential customers.
	Understand customer needs and provide appropriate product or service solutions.


Product Knowledge and Sales Presentations:


	Acquire in-depth knowledge of the company&#39;s products or services.
	Conduct compelling sales presentations and product demonstrations to showcase the benefits to clients.


Negotiation and Closing Deals:


	Skilfully negotiate contract terms, pricing, and conditions to reach mutually beneficial agreements.
	Close sales deals and secure contracts with new and existing clients.


Sales Reporting and Forecasting:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date sales records, including sales calls, meetings, and deals closed.
	Provide regular sales reports, forecasts, and updates to sales management.


Market Analysis:


	Stay informed about industry trends, market developments, and competitor activities.
	Use market insights to adjust sales strategies and identify potential business opportunities.


Collaboration:


	Work collaboratively with the sales team, marketing, customer support, and other departments to ensure a seamless customer experience.
	Participate in team meetings and share insights and best practices.


Salary
